title: 2 Mass. brothers aboard an aid flotilla to Gaza have been detained by Israeli forces: Here’s what we know.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: World News The two Sheffield men were arrested by Israeli forces and taken to Ashdod after their boats were intercepted Wednesday and Thursday.

title: Alex Cora says Brayan Bello, all Red Sox relievers are available to pitch in Game 3 vs. Yankees
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox “Hopefully today we can score a bunch of runs and they keep me out of it.
" Alex Cora said that it will be all hands on deck in Boston's bullpen on Thursday.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Conor Ryan October 2, 2025 | 7:08 PM 2 minutes to read With the Red Sox’ season on the line, Alex Cora said Thursday that it will be all hands on deck in Boston’s bullpen for Game 3 in the Wild Card Series.

title: Patriots DT Milton Williams misses practice with ankle injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams was a limited participant on Wednesday before being downgraded to out on Thursday.

Milton Williams John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe FOXBOROUGH — Patriots defensive tackle Milton Williams did not participate in practice on Wednesday, popping up on the injury report with an ankle injury.
Williams was a limited participant on Wednesday before being downgraded to out on Thursday.

title: Josh McDaniels gave a humorous response to Stefon Diggs’ ‘5 out of 10’ comment
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs was being modest about how comfortable he is within the Patriots' offense, McDaniels said.

Stefon Diggs and Josh McDaniels AP Photo/Charles Krupa FOXBOROUGH — Stefon Diggs took a humble approach to a question about how comfortable he is within the Patriots’ offense after his first 100-yard game of the season on Sunday.
“Five out of 10,” he said, shrugging his shoulders.

title: Is Drake Maye ready for prime time? Sunday night will be his first real chance to show it.

title: Body from unsolved 1974 murder exhumed from North Shore cemetery
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime “What happened to Henry has never left this town.
" Henry Bedard, and the baseball bat that was found at the scene.
Swampscott Police Department A body was exhumed Wednesday from a cemetery in relation to the unsolved murder of a 15-year-old Swampscott boy in 1974.
